summary: This is an affidavit from a security consultant detailing his professional background, his security work for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 to her arrest, the security threats she faced, and the events surrounding her arrest on July 2, 2020. The consultant also states his company will post a $1 million bond for her bail application.

persons.name: Security Consultant 1
persons.context: The author of the affidavit. He details his 25-year military and security background, his provision of security services for Ghislaine Maxwell, and his company's intent to post her bail bond.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary subject of the security consultant's services. The affidavit details security protocols for her, the threats she faced, and the events of her arrest. She is the subject of a renewed bail application.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of death threats against Ghislaine Maxwell due to her relationship with him some 20 years prior.

persons.name: Princess Diana
persons.context: Cited as an example of a life lost due to press intrusion, used to justify the need for stringent security protocols for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Security Consultant 1 and his company provided security consultation and services for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest.
The affidavit states Ghislaine Maxwell received death threats connected to her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 20 years prior.
Security Consultant 1's company is posting a $1 million bond in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, a first for the consultant.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein Announced
events.description: The announcement of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The security consultant's risk assessment after this date showed Ghislaine Maxwell was at substantial risk.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents arrested Ghislaine Maxwell at a residence in Bradford, New Hampshire. The arrest was preceded by security alerts about a helicopter and vehicles approaching the property.

events.title: Affidavit Signed
events.description: The security consultant signed this affidavit in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application.

keyFacts: A security consultant states Ghislaine Maxwell received death threats connected to her past relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
The consultant details the security protocols and events leading up to Maxwell's arrest by the FBI on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The consultant's company is posting a $1 million bond for Maxwell's bail application, which he states is the first time he has ever posted a bond for a client.
The affidavit is signed and dated November 25, 2020, in support of Maxwell's renewed bail application.
The security assessment indicated Maxwell was at 'substantial risk' following the announcement of Epstein's death in August 2019.
